block.p: TESORO PETROLEUM INC., San Antonio, an oil refiner and fuel seller, agreed to buy eight gasoline stations in the western United States from closely held Gary-Williams Retail Co. for an undisclosed price.

ROHM & HAAS CO., Philadelphia, the largest United States specialty-chemical maker, agreed to buy a unit of Mitsubishi Chemical Corp. that makes chemicals used in the production of semiconductors. Financial terms were not disclosed.

SAKS INC., Birmingham, Ala., the department store company, said it would close a Parisian store in Orlando, Fla., which employs about 140.

KENDLE INTERNATIONAL INC., Cincinnati, a researcher for drug and biotechnology companies, said it would cut about 125 full-time jobs, or 8 percent of its work force, because of an industrywide slowdown.
